title.narrative: PRCS CASH for Migration with CAR

description.narrative: The government of Pakistan initiated a cash assistance programme (Ehsaas) to provide financial relief to the neediest members of society. However, refugees, undocumented migrants and stateless people are ineligible for this relief, despite being amongst the most vulnerable. Afghan refugees in Pakistan tend to be daily wage earners, and therefore lost all income sources with the advent of both the general lockdown as well as Pakistan's "smartlockdown". Unable to provide for themselves, and excluded from government and UNHCR assistance, Afghan refugees face serious livelihoods impacts and food insecurity.Â Pakistan Red Crescent Society has been requested by the Commissionerate for Afghan Refugees (CAR) to provide both cash and material assistance to this extremely vulnerable population. Cash would provide refugee families with immediate relief, allowing them to make their own decisions as to how best to support themselves.Â This is the first opportunity for PRCS to work together with the government of Pakistan to support migrants in any meaningful way, and if successful, opens the door to becoming a primary partner for future refugee and migrant interventions. The project is part of a bigger engagement in the country. The project aims to address the financial needs of the Afghan refugee community, and in anticipation of a likely second wave of infections, PRCS proposes to provide 1,300 households with 12,000 rupees, in line with the government Ehsaas programme amount.Â
